lines.content: A-TextUiTesting: Test using I/O redirection technique
A-JUnit: To assist in creating appropriate JUnit tests
### üó£Ô∏èüì¢ TO ALL YOU BUSY BUSY BUSINESS LADIES (and gents) OUT THERE!!

TaskFairy is your own personal desktop bestie to help you stay on top of all your tasks üßö‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è! She is **a desktop app for managing _all kinds of tasks_!!** With a quick and easy-to-use **Command Line Interface** (CLI) to type in and organise your various kinds of tasks, coupled with a cute, girly GUI to add a little sparkle of fairy dust to your boring planning routine~ ü™Ñ‚ú®!
TaskFairy makes it easy to get started with your task management needs! Here's how to get her all set up...ü™Ñ
1. Ensure that you have Java `17` or above installed in your computer ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
2. Download the latest `.jar` file from [here](https://github.com/sannie-beep/ip/releases) ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the *home folder* for your TaskFairy ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
4. Open a command terminal, `cd` into the folder you put the jar file in and use the `java -jar taskfairy.jar` command to run the application ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
A GUI similar to the screenshot at the top of the page should appear! ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
You're all set to start adding tasks to your list and planning out your schedule, girlboss!üßö‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
### To note about the command format ü™Ñ:
- Words in `UPPER_CASE` or `DATETIME_FORMAT` are the parameters to be supplied by you, the user.\
e.g. in `deadline DESCRIPTION /by DEADLINE_DATE_AND_TIME`, `DESCRIPTION` and  `DEADLINE_DATE_AND_TIME` are parameters that can be used as `deadline by/ 6/6/2020`.
- Parameters MUST be added in the specified order.\
e.g. `event DESCRIPTION /from FROM_DATE_AND_TIME /to TO__DATE_AND_TIME` **cannot** be re-ordered as `event DESCRIPTION /to TO__DATE_AND_TIME /from FROM_DATE_AND_TIME`
- Extraneous parameters for commands that do not take in parameters (such as `help`, `list` and `bye`) will be ignored.\
e.g. if the command specifies `help me`, it will be interpreted as `help`.
Displays all available commands TaskFairy supports ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
Adds a new `todo` task to the list ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
Adds a new `deadline` task to the list, with a description and deadline in the format `M/d/yyyy HHmm`‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
- The `DEADLINE_DATE_AND_TIME` **must be in the format** `M/d/yyyy HHmm`
Adds a new `event` task to the list, with a description, from and to details in the format `M/d/yyyy HHmm`‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
- The `FROM_DATE_AND_TIME` and `TO_DATE_AND_TIME` **must be in the format** `M/d/yyyy HHmm`
Adds a new `do...after` task to the list, with a description and date to do after in the format `M/d/yyyy HHmm`‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
- The `DO_AFTER_DATE_AND_TIME` **must be in the format** `M/d/yyyy HHmm`
- `do steer company in new direction as new CEO ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ /after 5/10/2020 0800`
Deletes the specified task from your list ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
- Deletes the task at the specified `INDEX`
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list
- The index **must be a positive integer** 1,2,3,...
- `list` followed by `delete 2` deletes the 2nd task in the list
Shows your task list, including what has been marked as done and not done.
Mark a task as done with the `mark` command, or unmark it with `unmark` ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
- Marks/unmarks the task at the specified `INDEX`
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list
- The index **must be a positive integer** 1,2,3,...
- `list` followed by `mark 2` marks the 2nd task in the list as done
Finds tasks whose descriptions contain any of the given keywords ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
- The search is **CASE-SENSITIVE** e.g. `beth` is **NOT** the same as ``Beth``
- The **ORDER** of the keywords **MATTERS** e.g. `email beth` **DOES NOT MATCH** `beth email`
- Only **FULL WORDS** will be matched e.g. `beth` will not match `bethany`
- `find beth` returns `[T][] email beth` and `[D][] update beth (by: Jun 07 2020, 10:00am)`
Your fairy will respond to other commands with a touch of magic! üßö‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
Format: Up to you to find out üòâ‚ú®
> Hint: try greeting her or insulting her (not too much though, she has feelings too üò¢)
Here's a quick reference for all the available commands ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
| **Add a todo task**              | `todo DESCRIPTION`                      | `todo buy groceries`                                        |
| **Add a deadline task**          | `deadline DESCRIPTION /by DEADLINE_DATE_AND_TIME` | `deadline project proposal /by 5/7/2020 2359`               |
| **Add an event task**            | `event DESCRIPTION /from FROM_DATE_AND_TIME /to TO_DATE_AND_TIME` | `event meeting /from 5/3/2020 1500 /to 5/3/2020 1700`       |
| **Add a do-after task**          | `do DESCRIPTION /after DO_AFTER_DATE_AND_TIME` | `do meeting minutes /after 5/3/2020 1700`                    |
| **Unmark a task as not done**    | `unmark INDEX`                          | `unmark 2`                                                  |
| **Find tasks by keyword**        | `find KEYWORD [MORE_KEYWORDS]`          | `find beth` / `find email beth`                                             |

### üó£Ô∏èüì¢ TO ALL YOU BUSY BUSY BUSINESS LADIES (and gents) OUT THERE!!

TaskFairy is your own personal desktop bestie to help you stay on top of all your tasks üßö‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è! She is **a desktop app for managing _all kinds of tasks_!!** With a quick and easy-to-use **Command Line Interface** (CLI) to type in and organise your various kinds of tasks, coupled with a cute, girly GUI to add a little sparkle of fairy dust to your boring planning routine~ ü™Ñ‚ú®!
TaskFairy makes it easy to get started with your task management needs! Here's how to get her all set up...ü™Ñ
1. Ensure that you have Java `17` or above installed in your computer ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
2. Download the latest `.jar` file from [here](https://github.com/sannie-beep/ip/releases) ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the *home folder* for your TaskFairy ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
4. Open a command terminal, `cd` into the folder you put the jar file in and use the `java -jar taskfairy.jar` command to run the application ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
A GUI similar to the screenshot at the top of the page should appear! ‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
You're all set to start adding tasks to your list and planning out your schedule, girlboss!üßö‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚äπ ‡£™ Àñ
### To note about the command format ü™Ñ:
- Words in `UPPER_CASE` or `DATETIME_FORMAT` are the parameters to be supplied by you, the user.\
e.g. in `deadline DESCRIPTION /by DEADLINE_DATE_AND_TIME`, `DESCRIPTION` and  `DEADLINE_DATE_AND_TIME` are parameters that can be used as `deadline by/ 6/6/2020`.
- Parameters MUST be added in the specified order.\
e.g. `event DESCRIPTION /from FROM_DATE_AND_TIME /to TO__DATE_AND_TIME` **cannot** be re-ordered as `event DESCRIPTION /to TO__DATE_AND_TIME /from FROM_DATE_AND_TIME`
- Extraneous parameters for commands that do not take in parameters (such as `help`, `list` and `bye`) will be ignored.\
e.g. if the command specifies `help me`, it will be interpreted as `help`.

* It extends the ArrayList to provide custom methods for managing tasks.

* Returns a message indicating that a task has been marked as not done.
* @param task The task that has been marked as done.
return "Aww, I've unmarked this task\u2728:\n " + task;

* @param tasks The list of tasks that match the search.
public String showMatchingTasks(TaskList tasks, int mainListSize) {

response = "Honey, there's no task like that in your list :/ \u2728.";
* Returns a help message showing all available commands and their format.
return "Here are the available commands, honey:\n" +
"\u2728 mark <task number> - Mark a task as done.\n" +
"\u2728 unmark <task number> - Unmark a task as not done.\n" +
"\u2728 todo <description> - Add a new todo task.\n" +
"\u2728 deadline <description> /by <M/d/yyyy HHmm> - Add a new deadline task.\n" +
"\u2728 do <description> /after <M/d/yyyy HHmm> - Add a task to do after a certain time.\n" +
"\u2728 event <description> /from <M/d/yyyy HHmm> /to <M/d/yyyy HHmm> - Add a new event.\n" +
